reviews.review_msg: Would not recommend this class to anyone who is looking for a GPA booster or an easy elective before graduating. Im in my last semester of my degree and this class will be severely lowering my GPA. Unnecessary amount of info must be memorized, more work than a 5th year class, and very specific exam questions. I highly regret taking this course.

Extensive amount of unnecessary info tested. Use study questions provided as a guideline for midterm and final. They're taken directly, but do every question, she'll test the one you didn't do. Diet analysis is time consuming, finish it early. Overall, what you put in is what you get out

Thought this was a decent class until the final which I thought was super easy but when the marks I did poorly :S The DAP project was so confusing(Part 2 anyways). But the prof said she would work on that for next sem since it was a huge problem for many students. Overall, I found the content of the class to be useful.

Strongly discourage taking course. Absolutely ridiculous for a 1st year course;never had a course with so much material.Tested on literally 2X the material as other courses.Not worth 3 credits for amount of work.Won't maintain GPA&am A student.Excessive amounts of material makes it impossible to remember.StudyQ guidelines far from actual tested Qs.

very tough course. unnecessary information dumped onto students. incredibly hard exams. for a first year course, and most students taking it as electives, this course will take up alot of your time and be prepared to put in significant effort.

The course and textbook is excellent except the final sucks like crap! Be prepared to memorize every little fact from the textbook/lecture especially the science part even though she says she's not going to test very hard on the science part ie. digestion through human body, molecules etc. I love kin but her exams killed me :'(
